children.description: Provide Bioinformatics Services involves the creation and advancement of databases, algorithms, computational and statistical techniques and theory to solve formal and practical problems arising from the management and analysis of biological data.
children.name: Provide Bioinformatics Services

children.commentary: Conduct Health Care Research LOB serves as a centralized location for health care research topics in the BFF.   Biomedical Laboratory, Health Services, Clinical and Rehabilitation research topics are covered by this LOB.
children.description: Conduct Health Care Research includes developing new strategies to handle diseases; identifying new means for delivery of services, methods, decision models and practices; managing clinical trials and research quality, ultimately making strides in quality improvement.
children.name: Conduct Health Care Research

children.description: Administer Academic Education Program Policies involves maintaining formal guidelines regarding relationships between academic institutions and healthcare facilities and delineating the authority for the conduct of health professions' clinical training program.
children.name: Administer Academic Education Program Policies

children.description: Establish Agreements with Academic Institutions involves establishing and maintaining affiliations with medical schools and universities to increase the involvement in the residency training program.  It also includes developing terms and conditions for acceptance of students or providers into internships or training programs.
children.name: Establish Agreements with Academic Institutions

children.description: Select Health Care Resident and Fellowship Candidates includes announcing openings for medical residency positions,  screening and accepting of medical school graduates into  programs, assigning residents to medical units, and administering special fellowship programs.
children.name: Select Health Care Resident and Fellowship Candidates

children.commentary: Training programs provide a flexible, custom learning environment that include simulation, distance, virtual and self-service learning options. Note:  Allied health professionals are students that are being mentored by VA employees or someone from their training institution. E.g. psychologists, social workers, specialty care, etc. - a wide range of health care providers.
children.description: Provide Education and Training Programs is the VHA offering of unit courses, training sessions, internships, residencies and supervision to healthcare students and providers. This encompasses training for allied health professionals and medical and dental students and residents.
children.name: Provide Education and Training Programs

children.description: Provide Feedback to Academic Institutions is the process for collecting and sending training feedback to parent institutions.
children.name: Provide Feedback to Academic Institutions

children.commentary: Provide Health Care Education serves as a centralized location for health care education topics in the BFF.  Health Care Education is provided to allied health professionals and medical and dental students and residents.  Allied health professionals are students that are being mentored by VA employees or someone from their training institution. E.g. psychologists, social workers, specialty care, etc. - a wide range of health care providers.   The VHA employee education and training components can be found under the Human Resource function in Managing Business Enabling Services.
children.description: Provide Health Care Education fosters advancement in health knowledge. This includes promoting healthcare knowledge advancement and providing for practitioner education. It also includes provision of clinical education sites for trainees across all health professions and in conjunction with educational institutions.
children.name: Provide Health Care Education

children.description: Maintain Facilities involves establishing a facility maintenance program to ensure the upkeep and supervision of the buildings and grounds, as well as the physical plant. Also included in this is any equipment requiring engineering expertise, and  facility or engineering Work Orders such as the Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) system, and utilities, as well as the ability for tracking.
children.name: Maintain Facilities

children.description: Conduct Facility Shipping and Receiving involves effectively and efficiently receiving, verifying and delivering items on a regular basis that arrive at the facility. This may also include preparing and shipping freight, hospital and lab supplies, equipment, personal patient items, shipment tracking, damage claims processing and proof of delivery.
children.name: Conduct Facility Shipping and Receiving

children.description: Provide Facility Procurement, Warehousing and Supplies involves managing requisitions, researching price quotes, performing inventory management and inventory control thereby ensuring adequate supplies are available to support the mission of the facility.
children.name: Provide Facility Procurement, Warehousing, and Supplies

children.description: Provide Facility Housekeeping involves providing a facility housekeeping service which ensures a high standard of cleanliness and general upkeep in all areas in compliance with national guidelines. This should include dissemination of safety and security regulations to all staff with an emphasis on  staff education.
children.name: Provide Facility Housekeeping

children.description: Provide Facility Waste Management involves developing a comprehensive program for facility waste management and bio hazard management in compliance with regulatory guidelines. This may include identification of personnel and equipment, quantities and nature of generated waste, identifying areas for waste minimization and reuse or recycling of waste. Handling, shipping, transport and storage of waste are integral parts of this program.
children.name: Provide Facility Waste Management

children.description: Deliver Utility Services involves the procurement and maintenance of utility services to include water, power, communications, and Heating, Ventilation, and Air Condition (HVAC) systems.
children.name: Deliver Utility Services

children.description: Provide Support for Medical Equipment includes the tasks necessary to ensure the proper functioning of a wide range of health care products used to diagnose, monitor or treat diseases or medical conditions.
children.name: Provide Support for Medical Equipment

children.description: Manage Facilities, Fleet and Equipment involves the maintenance, administration, certification, and operation of office buildings, fleets, machinery, and other assets that are possessions of the organization.
children.name: Manage Facilities, Fleet and Equipment

children.description: Provide Security Services involves managing the physical protection of the organization’s personnel, assets, and facilities (including security clearance management).  This involves establishing a security program (including utilization of VA facility police forces) which incorporates a series of safeguards designed to protect the physical property and ensure safety for personnel interacting within this environment. Identification and risk assessment of security vulnerabilities should be part of this program.
children.name: Provide Security Services

children.description: Manage Employee Travel involves the activities associated with planning, preparing, monitoring, and approving of business related travel for the organization’s employees.
children.name: Manage Employee Travel

children.commentary: This function involves overseeing compliance with all federally imposed laws (Sarbanes-Oxley, HIPAA, DISA, GLBA, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), FISMA, NIST, PCI DSS, Microsoft Hardening, Privacy Policy Guidelines, etc) as well as internally applicable laws (local workplace policies, time reporting requirements, employee dress codes, etc). This specifically ensures adherence to Federal mandates and industry best practices. Note: This function addresses all policies that are non-clinical in nature. See function Evaluate Standards Compliance for clinical policy oversight.
children.description: Provide Administration Policy Support involves the adoption, dissemination, and monitoring the adherence to all non-clinical administrative laws and policies.  These policies can be federally mandated or legislated within the agency. This includes alerting staff to changes in policy as well as conducting quality assurance reviews and audits to ensure compliance to all regulations.
children.name: Provide Administration Policy Support

children.description: Manage VHA-Wide Administrative Services involves the day-to-day management and maintenance of the internal infrastructure.
children.name: Manage VHA-Wide Administrative Services

children.description: Provide Facility Information Management Support includes the functions and work processes associated with a hospital, clinic, or other facilities not including, maintenance and engineering, security, supply chain management, waste management, or infrastructure and reengineering.  This may include information management functions which provides the design considerations, requirements, and examples for onboard information management. It may also refer to the storage, transmission, manipulation, and display of information and therefore may include all hardware and software to support these functions.
children.name: Provide Facility Information Management Support

children.description: Provide Technology Assessment provides information and technology assessment services to the organization's senior managers and clinicians.  Provide Technology Assessment also supports national working groups and guideline development groups with a broad range of products designed for policy- and decision-support needs.  Products range from literature searches that identify citations relevant to clients’ own evidence reviews, 'scoping searches', and quality-filtered bibliographies to comprehensive technology assessments.
children.name: Provide Technology Assessment

children.description: Provide Business Software for Transactions and Analytical Purposes, which may include payment gateways, software applications, online bill paying, and payment to merchant account providers.
children.name: Provide Business Software for Transactions and Analytical Purposes

children.description: Provide System Development includes supporting all activities associated with the in-house design and development of software applications. This includes developing requirements, validation, training, and user (stakeholder) ownership and acceptance.
children.name: Provide System Development

children.description: Utilize Single Sign On is the provision of multiple methods of authentication (User-ID and password, VA Personal Identification  Verification (PIV) card, DoD Common Access Card (CAC)) which result in a user presenting credentials once  but being able to access multiple clinical applications after the initial authentication, resulting in a single sign on.
children.name: Utilize Single Sign On

children.description: Provide Patient Information Security  includes the steps health care providers must take to guard patients' "protected health information" commonly referred to as PHI, from unauthorized access or breaches of privacy or confidentiality. Security also refers to maintaining the integrity of electronic medical information, and ensuring availability to those who need access and are authorized to view such clinical data, including images, for the purposes of patient care. The federal government requires the secure handling of electronic media and PHI with standards put forth in the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) of 1996.
children.name: Provide Patient Information Security

children.description: Provide Information Security involves all functions pertaining to the protection of information and information systems from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruptions, modification, or destruction, as well as the creation and implementation of security policies, procedures and controls.
children.name: Provide Information Security

children.description: Monitor Internal Health Data focuses on implementing procedures and updates to ensure data is within acceptable industry standards to allow for proper internal management and analysis and external exchange.
children.name: Monitor Internal Health Data

children.description: Provide Health Data Processing Management and Collaboration encompasses managing internal health data, sharing and exchanging health data and information with partners.
children.name: Provide Health Data Processing Management and Collaboration

children.description: Perform Record Retention involves the operations surrounding the retention of the official documents and records for the agency.
children.name: Perform Record Retention

children.description: Support Communication with Medical Devices provides support for data captured form medical devices, which may occur in the hospital, clinic or the patient's home. Some examples include vital signs, pulse oximetry home diagnostic devices for chronic illnesses, laboratory machines, bar coded artifacts (medicine, immunizations, demographics, history, and identification), etc.
children.name: Support Communication with Medical Devices

children.description: Provide Internal Electronic Information Exchange enables secure bi-directional communication of information electronically between practitioners and pharmacies or between practitioner and intended recipient of pharmacy orders. When a medication is prescribed, the order is routed to the pharmacy or other intended recipient of pharmacy orders. This information is used to avoid transcription errors and facilitate detection of potential adverse reactions. If there is a question from the pharmacy, that communication can be presented to the provider with their other tasks. The transmission of prescription data between systems should conform to realm acceptable messaging standards.
children.name: Provide Internal Electronic Information Exchange

children.description: Provide Partner Interoperability, Collaboration, Sharing and Exchange encompasses sharing of health data, e.g. Electronic Health Record (EHR), and information with all external partners.
children.name: Provide Partner Interoperability, Collaboration, Sharing, and Exchange

children.description: Establish Standards for Data Interchange involves determining and approving interoperability or interchange and messaging standards (internal or external) with other systems. These systems include EHR systems, applications within EHRs or entities that interact with EHRs.  Recognized standards should be adhered to with a common understanding of rules regarding connectivity, information structures, formats, semantics, terminology and vocabulary, thus allowing for data exchange.
children.name: Establish Standards for Data Interchange

children.description: Provide Inter-Provider Communication involves developing and implementing mechanisms for secure communication of patient data among providers. This must be in compliance with federal and jurisdictional laws regarding privacy regulations. This function supports virtual medicine non-telehealth initiatives.
children.name: Provide Inter-Provider Communication

children.description: Provide Electronic Communication Between Provider and Patient facilitates the communications between providers and patients and/or patient representatives to capture the nature and content of electronic communication, or the time and details of other communication.   This function supports virtual medicine non-telehealth initiatives.
children.name: Provide Electronic Communication Between Provider and Patient

children.description: Provide Support for Notification and Response provides a system of notifications, based on an external authoritative source of a health risk within a specific patient population. After the notification is provided, a suggested course of action is recommended.
children.name: Provide Support for Notification and Response

children.description: Provide Centers of Excellence Support (formerly Miami Development Center) provides a center of excellence for the use of clinical and administrative data for decision support.  It uses VA national databases as well as other data sources to create various reports and models that support the VA health care delivery system on topics such as workload, productivity, costs, and staffing.  It also conducts research utilizing clinical data and provides education and consultation on the manipulation of databases.
children.name: Provide Centers of Excellence Support

children.description: Provide Support to Identify Potential Problems and Trends is the utilization of current concepts from the literature to identify potential problems or trends. This may involve utilization of various assessment tools, clinical decision support tools, clinical reminders or other predictive analytical tools.
children.name: Provide Support to Identify Potential Problems and Trends

children.description: Share Enterprise Information relates to any method or function, for a given business area, facilitating: data being received in a usable medium by one or more departments or agencies as provided by a separate department or agency or other entity; and data being provided, disseminated or otherwise made available or accessible by one department or agency for use by one or more separate departments or agencies, or other entities, as appropriate.
children.name: Share Enterprise Information

children.description: Provide System Alerts enables the ability to send out a message that relates to server and resource use. The messages notify users about problems in areas such as security and access, user sessions, server shutdown due to power loss (when an uninterruptible power supply is available), directories replication, and printing.
children.name: Provide System Alerts

children.description: Perform Clinical Data Quality Verification and Validation involves implementing processes and procedures that ensures data quality, verification and validation. Implement operating policies and ongoing mechanisms to monitor data quality and resolve discrepancies.
children.name: Perform Clinical Data Quality Verification, Validation

children.description: Monitor Systems and Networks involves real-time monitoring of systems and networks to ensure optimal performance.
children.name: Monitor Systems and Networks

children.description: Provide Identity and Access Management (IAM) involves the information management practice to identify requested access, limit access and manage the data used in an information system to authenticate users and grant or deny access rights to data and system resources. The access and entry is limited to appropriate levels based on user role-profile attributions, and access authorization level.
children.name: Provide Identity and Access Management

children.description: Provide Clinical Patient Identity Management is comprised of a set of business processes, and a supporting infrastructure, for the creation, maintenance, and use of digital identities and unique identification of patients and a matching capability to resolve and prevent identity problems.
children.name: Provide Clinical Patient Identity Management

children.description: Provide Person Identity Management is comprised of a set of business processes, and a supporting infrastructure, for the creation, maintenance, and use of digital identities and unique identification of persons other than patients (providers, employees, etc.) prevent identity problems.
children.name: Provide Person Identity Management

children.description: Provide Role Base Identity Management allows for properly identifying clinical organizations, departments, patients, health employees and care providers in terms of identifying and authorizing access across health information systems and networks.
children.name: Provide Role Base Identity Management

children.description: Provide Identity Management includes identifying individuals in a system (such as a country, a network, or an organization) and controlling their access to the resources in that system by restricting their authorizations as appropriate to their role.
children.name: Provide Identity Management

children.description: Provide Lifecycle Management involves supporting development of Change Management (CM) processes that facilitate a smooth evolution, composition, and transition of agency resources (people, processes, and tools) in response to IT development, implementation or acquisition efforts.
children.name: Provide Lifecycle Management

children.description: Provide Information Management involves supporting the establishment and management of policies, guidelines, and standards regarding the collection, storage, dissemination, and destruction of  information.
children.name: Provide Information Management

children.description: Provide IT Infrastructure Maintenance involves the planning, design, and maintenance of an IT Infrastructure to include platforms, networks, servers, printers, cables, peripherals, etc.
children.name: Provide IT Infrastructure Maintenance

children.description: Provide System Maintenance includes supporting all activities associated with the maintenance of in-house designed software applications. This includes designing and deploying patches, updates, reboots, or performing routine maintenance functions.
children.name: Provide System Maintenance

children.description: Utilize Information Technology Services involves the coordination of information and technology resources and systems required to support or provide a service.
children.name: Utilize Information Technology Services

children.description: Acquire Fixed Assets involves procuring fixed (capitalized) assets.
children.name: Acquire Fixed Assets

children.description: Inventory Fixed Assets includes conducting periodic inventory (usually annually) of fixed and capital assets and reconciling any discrepancies.  Appropriate documentation is maintained in Equipment Inventory Listing (EIL) from previous inventory until reconciliation of current inventory and then archived in accordance with Records Control Management procedures.
children.name: Inventory Fixed Assets

children.description: Monitor Fixed Assets includes tracking and maintaining records on individual fixed and capital assets from receipt through disposition ('cradle to grave') process.
children.name: Monitor Fixed Assets

children.description: Perform Fixed Asset Analysis involves providing financial analysis and reconciliation for fixed (capitalized) assets, e.g. calculates depreciation, and conducts "what if" scenarios for fixed assets.
children.name: Perform Fixed Asset Analysis

children.description: Manage Fixed Assets involves developing and implementing the financial functions to monitor and record the purchase of Fixed Assets.
children.name: Manage Fixed Assets

children.description: Acquire Goods and Services involves the procurement of physical goods, products, and services to be used by the agency.
children.name: Acquire Goods and Services

children.description: Control Inventory involves balancing the costs of inventory with the benefits of inventory. Inventory management functions ensure: desired stock levels of items, automatically generated replenishment orders, dispense goods to supported services or end users, identify items via bar code technology, supports communication of inventory information between a secondary inventory point and its associated automated supply points and produces reports displaying inventory level, distributions, and dollar values.  Inventory Control refers to the tracking of information related to procured assets and resources with regard to quantity, quality, and location.  Note:  Pharmacy inventory is managed by the pharmacist in the care setting.
children.name: Control Inventory

children.description: Monitor Contracts involves the oversight and management of contractors and service providers from the private sector.
children.name: Monitor Contracts

children.description: Conduct Supply Chain Operations involves the purchasing, tracking, and monitoring usage of goods and services.
children.name: Conduct Supply Chain Operations

children.description: Manage Employee Performance designs, develops, and implements a comprehensive performance management approach to ensure agency employees are demonstrating competencies required of their work assignments. Design, develop and implement a comprehensive performance management strategy that enables managers to make distinctions in performance and links individual performance to agency goal and mission accomplishment. This also includes managing employee performance at the individual level and evaluating the overall effectiveness of the agency’s employee development approach.
children.name: Manage Employee Performance

children.description: Manage Staff Recruitment and Retention establishes procedures for recruiting, selecting, and retaining high-quality, productive employees with the right skills and competencies, in accordance with merit system principles. This includes: developing a staffing strategy and plan; establishing an applicant evaluation approach; announcing the vacancy, sourcing and evaluating candidates against the competency requirements for the position; initiating pre-employment activities; and hiring employees.
children.name: Manage Staff Recruitment and Retention

children.description: Manage Employee Relations designs, develops, and implements programs that strive to maintain an effective employer-employee relationship that balance the agency’s needs against its employees’ rights. This includes: addressing employee misconduct; addressing employee performance problems; managing  administrative grievances; providing employee accommodation; administering employees assistance programs; participating in administrative third party proceedings; and determining candidate and applicant suitability.
children.name: Manage Employee Relations

children.description: Manage Workforce Time and Attendance involves recording the working and non-working hours of employees, contractors, volunteers, and other members of the workforce. The recording of the number of hours spent on specific tasks is used by job costing, workload forecasting, payroll processing and other activities.
children.name: Manage Workforce Time and Attendance

children.description: Manage Employee Separations conducts efficient and effective employee separation programs that assist employees in transitioning employment to outside the agency; facilitates the removal of unproductive, non-performing employees; and assists employees in transitioning to retirement.
children.name: Manage Employee Separations

children.description: Monitor Employee Training provides for tracking and monitoring all personnel training.
children.name: Monitor Employee Training

children.description: Provide Health Information Technology Training is a key component of VA health care. VA eHealth University (VeHU) is VA’s major annual training conference which provides education on the Computerized Patient Record System (CPRS) and related clinical software (VistA) developed by the Veterans  Health Administration (VHA).  This conference highlights current innovations for patient care utilizing over 200 training classes on VA’s clinical informatics products. Simulation Learning Education and Research Network (SimLEARN) is the VHA’s program for simulation in health care training.  SimLEARN provides an ever-growing collection of research and publications, methods and curricula related to simulation in health care.
children.name: Provide Health Information Technology Training

children.description: Provide Health Personnel Education involves the developing and execution of programs aimed at educating and training health care providers and personnel.
children.name: Provide Health Personnel Education

children.description: Provide Employee Development Training is responsible for the appropriate staff receiving the appropriate training for the development and maintenance of a competent workforce. It establishes responsibility and procedures for designating education or training as mandatory or required. Training needs may originate from Executive Orders, Congressional mandates, Office of Personnel Management, the agency, and its various program offices or other regulatory agencies.
children.name: Provide Employee Development Training

children.description: Provide Human Resource Awareness Training allows for tracking employee training. It provides the ability to track the mandatory training for all employees which is due on an annual basis. It also provides alerts to the employee notifying the employee that the training is due.
children.name: Provide Human Resource Awareness Training

children.description: Provide Senior Leadership Development involves assisting individuals currently in or moving to a leadership position within the organization improve their leadership and management skills. This includes providing conferences, training, and certification programs for government managers.
children.name: Provide Senior Leadership Development

children.description: Provide Human Resources Development designs, develops, and implements a comprehensive employee development approach to ensure that agency employees have the right competencies and skills for current and future work assignments. This includes conducting employee development needs assessments; designing employee development programs; administering and delivering employee development programs; and evaluating the overall effectiveness of the agency’s employee development approach.
children.name: Provide Human Resources Development

children.description: Develop Health Career Opportunities provides for development and evaluation of new health careers, interdisciplinary approaches, and career advancement opportunities when appropriate.
children.name: Develop Health Career Opportunities

children.description: Implement Veteran Recruitment, Training and Employment involves the recruitment, training, and employment of Veterans.
children.name: Implement Veteran Recruitment, Training and Employment

children.description: Provide Organization and Position Management designs, develops, and implements organizational and position structures that create a high-performance, competency-driven framework that both advances the agency mission and serves agency human capital needs.
children.name: Provide Organization and Position Management

children.description: Provide Human Resources Strategy develops effective human capital management strategies to ensure the organization is able to recruit, select, develop, train, and manage a high-quality, productive workforce in accordance with merit system principles. This includes: conducting both internal and external environmental scans; developing human resources and human capital strategies and plans; establishing human resources policy and practices; managing current and future workforce competencies; developing workforce plans; developing succession plans; managing the human resources budget; providing human resources and human capital consultative support; and measuring and improving human resources performance.
children.name: Provide Human Resources Strategy

children.description: Manage Employee Compensation designs, develops, and implements compensation programs that attract, retain and fairly compensate agency employees. In addition, designs, develops, and implements pay for performance compensation programs to recognize and reward high performance, with both base pay increases and performance bonus payments. This function includes: developing and implementing compensation programs; administering bonus and monetary awards programs; administering pay changes; managing leave and payroll.
children.name: Manage Employee Compensation

children.description: Manage Employee Compensation Program provides methods for data tracking and managing employee's compensation cases in support of the Workman's Compensation laws.
children.name: Manage Employee Compensation Program

children.description: Manage Employee Health allows for the management and monitoring of employee health information to include screenings, fitness for work tests and other health related issues. Provides health services to employees at some facilities.  Includes employee mental health and drug and alcohol counseling.
children.name: Manage Employee Health

children.description: Manage Employee Benefits designs, develops, and implements benefit programs that attract, retain and support current and former agency employees. This includes: establishing and communicating benefits programs; processing benefits actions; and interacting as necessary with third party benefits providers.
children.name: Manage Employee Benefits

children.description: Manage Labor Relations provides oversight of the relationship between the agency and its unions and bargaining units. This includes negotiating and administering labor contracts and collective bargaining agreements; managing negotiated grievances; and participating in negotiated third party proceedings.
children.name: Manage Labor Relations

children.description: Manage Human Resources involves all activities associated with the recruitment and management of personnel, to include employees, contractors, volunteers and other members of the workforce. It involves HR Strategy which develops effective human capital management strategies to ensure federal organizations are able to recruit, select, develop, train, and manage a high-quality, productive workforce in accordance with merit system principles. This also includes: establishing human resources policy and practices; managing current and future workforce competencies; developing workforce plans; developing succession plans; managing the human resources budget; providing human resources and human capital consultative support; and measuring and improving human resources performance.
children.name: Manage Human Resources

children.description: Provide General Ledger Execution involves providing financial controls, data collection, and financial reporting to enable Government-wide data management. It is responsible for maintaining accurate account balances, reconciliation of accounts, accounting entries for gifts and donations, creating and processing journal entries, and closing sets of books in a timely manner; and support of production of financial reports.
children.name: Provide General Ledger Execution

children.description: Perform Budget Process involves handling budget execution, federal report definition, and the year-end closing process.
children.name: Perform Budget Process

children.description: Provide Veteran Personal Finance Management involves managing patient accounts in the VHA hospital system through the Veterans Personal Finance System (VPFS). This services is developed for Veterans not able to manage their own accounts.  They are typically in some supporting organization e.g. a group home.  Their pension payments go into this account and the funds are managed for the Veteran e.g. pay rent etc.
children.name: Provide Veteran Personal Finance Management

children.description: Provide Accounting Services entails accounting for assets, liabilities, fund balances, revenues and expenses associated with the maintenance of federal funds and expenditure of federal appropriations (Salaries and Expenses, Operation and Maintenance, Procurement, Working Capital, Real Property, Work in Progress and Construction, Trust Funds, etc.), in accordance with applicable federal standards.
children.name: Provide Accounting Services

children.description: Process Payments involves processing and managing payable accounts. Payment processing within the organization enables claimants, beneficiaries, employees, other government agencies (OGAs) and vendors to receive financial benefits, compensation, salaries, reimbursements, and payments for services or products. This activity creates financial control to prevent double payments. It also allows visibility of required information. It includes preparation, approval, scheduling, and processing of transactions that result in the disbursement of federal funds.
children.name: Process Payments

children.description: Process Health Care Reimbursements includes all processing of payments for health care outside of a VHA facility.  Includes beneficiary travel reimbursement.
children.name: Process Health Care Reimbursements

children.description: Manage CHAMPVA Payments involves the processing of shared costs of covered health care services and supplies with eligible beneficiaries under Civilian Health and Medical Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs (CHAMPVA).
children.name: Manage CHAMPVA Payments

children.description: Administer Purchased Care Contracts includes fee basis, determining capitation services and rates, conducting monthly financial calculations and reconciliations, distributing payments, performing premium billing activities and performing period-end risk pool settlements.
children.name: Administer Purchased Care Contracts

children.description: Administer Managed Care Contracts is the process by which the provider, payer and employer evaluates operating results and measures utilization of care under a specific contract and identifies steps required to ensure compliance.
children.name: Administer Managed Care Contracts

children.description: Manage Payments includes disbursements of agency funds, via a variety of mechanisms, to federal and private individuals, federal agencies, state, local and international governments, and the private sector, to effect payment for goods and services. This activity creates financial control to prevent double payments. It also allows visibility of required information. It includes preparation, approval, scheduling and processing of transactions that result in the disbursement of federal funds. Treasury payment processing, reconciliation and offset programs are included.
children.name: Manage Payments

children.description: Perform Receivables Processing includes processing of  receivables and includes all handling of funds owed to or received.  It includes receipt of funds, receipt of gifts and donations, offset of payments, and invoicing.
children.name: Perform Receivables Processing

children.description: Perform Collections Processing involves conducting research when third party collections are possible and preparing Statements of Account to collect as appropriate. It also receives remittances and follows up on overdue payments.  It also executes the authority granted to VA in 1986 to seek reimbursement from third-party insurers and assess copayments for furnished care to certain Veterans with annual incomes above an amount set by law.
children.name: Perform Collections Processing

children.description: Conduct Insurance Identification and Verification involves providing the ability for discovery of health care insurance (identification), and the determination of eligibility for claimed insurance (verification).  This includes confirmation of third party commercial health insurance coverage for registered patients.
children.name: Conduct Insurance Identification and Verification

children.description: Perform Billing and Claims Submissions is generating health care bills, and providing automated billing of customers, third parties and employees.
children.name: Perform Billing and Claims Submissions

children.description: Analyze Medical Services Utilization is the process of comparing requests for medical services ("utilization") to guidelines or criteria that are deemed appropriate for such services, and making a recommendation based on that comparison.  Includes pre-authorization from insurance companies.
children.name: Analyze Medical Services Utilization

children.description: Process Patient Co-Payments allows for processing of payments made by Beneficiaries who are required to make copayments for services at VHA facilities.
children.name: Process Patient Co-Payments

children.description: Manage Collections and Receivables includes the managing and processing of deposits, fund transfers, and receipts for sales or service. This includes the accounting for all monies owed to organization from other agencies, contractors, vendors, individuals, beneficiaries, employees, etc.
children.name: Manage Collections and Receivables

children.description: Manage Construction Accounts is performed when during construction, federally appropriated funds need to be managed until the building is accepted and capitalized as a VHA asset.
children.name: Manage Construction Accounts

children.description: Provide Real Estate Asset Accounting provides accounting support for managing the value of real estate assets and their related expenses such as buildings, land, and depreciation costs, including capital improvements.
children.name: Provide Real Estate Asset Accounting

children.description: Report Financial Information includes providing and reporting financial information, reporting and analysis of financial transactions.
children.name: Report Financial Information

children.description: Provide Cost Accounting and Performance Measurement involves the process of accumulating, measuring, analyzing, interpreting, and reporting cost information useful to both internal and external groups concerned with the way in which an organization uses, accounts for, safeguards, and controls its resources to meet its objectives. Cost accounting information is necessary in establishing strategic goals, measuring service efforts and accomplishments, and relating efforts to accomplishments. Also, cost accounting, financial accounting, and budgetary accounting all draw information from common data sources.
children.name: Provide Cost Accounting and Performance Measurement

children.description: Manage Payroll Time and Attendance involves providing oversight and managing the time and attendance information for processing employee payroll at Defense Finance Accounting System (DFAS).
children.name: Manage Payroll Time and Attendance

children.description: Provide Funds Control includes the management of the federal budget process including the development of plans and programs, budgets, and performance outputs as well as financing federal programs and operations through appropriation and apportionment of direct and reimbursable spending authority, fund transfers, investments and other financing mechanisms.
children.name: Provide Funds Control

children.description: Provide Financial Management includes performing functions related to financial management activities and reconciliation as well as functions related to transfer of funds between stakeholders and entities related to provision of medical care.  All financial management activities will adhere to VA and VHA financial directives and handbooks as well as other appropriate governance regulations and guidelines, and will maintain appropriate internal controls.  This activity also includes financial reporting, financial statements, and financial audits.
children.name: Provide Financial Management

children.description: Perform Budget Formulation involves all activities undertaken to determine priorities for future spending and to develop an itemized forecast of future funding and expenditures during a targeted period of time. This includes the collection and use of performance information to assess the effectiveness of programs and develop budget priorities.
children.name: Perform Budget Formulation

children.description: Perform Capital Planning involves the processes for ensuring that appropriate investments are selected for capital expenditures.
children.name: Perform Capital Planning

children.description: Provide Business Architecture involves implementing an established process for describing the current state and defining the target state and transition strategy for an organization’s people, processes, and technology. This includes collaboration with other enterprise architecture service groups such as OneVA.
children.name: Provide Business Architecture

children.description: Perform Strategic Planning  entails the determination of annual and long-term goals incorporating trend analysis, and the identification of the best approach for achieving those goals.
children.name: Perform Strategic Planning

children.description: Perform Budget Execution  involves the legal (apportionment) and managerial (allotment and sub-allotment) distribution of budget authority to achieve results consistent with the formulated budget.
children.name: Perform Budget Execution

children.description: Perform Management Improvement includes all efforts to gauge the ongoing efficiency of business processes and identify opportunities for reengineering or restructuring, as well as VHA Redesign Initiative.
children.name: Perform Management Improvement

children.commentary: Program Performance Assessments, Government Performance Results Act (GPRA) plans and reports, performance-based agency budget submissions, and Financial Management Cost Accounting and Performance Measurement data.
children.description: Perform Budget and Performance Integration involves activities that align Federal resources allocated through budget formulation, execution, and management actions with examinations of program objectives, performance, and demonstrated results.
children.name: Perform Budget and Performance Integration

children.description: Perform Planning and Budgeting involves the activities of determining strategic direction, identifying and establishing programs and processes, and allocating resources (capital and labor) among those programs and processes.
children.name: Perform Planning and Budgeting

children.description: Provide Enterprise Reporting involves the regular provision of information to decision-makers to support them in their work. These reports can take the form of graphs, text and tables, or written text. They may be disseminated through an intranet as a set of regularly updated web pages, emailed directly to users, or simply printed out and distributed manually. This activity often  involves the use of decision support systems for online analytical processing including data mining and predictive analytics.
children.name: Provide Enterprise Reporting

children.commentary: The mission of Business Enabling Services is to assist the administration in carrying out their goals and objectives in providing quality health care to our Veterans. To that end, Manage Business Enabling Services provides services in the areas of Accounting, IT, Human Resources, General Administration, Payroll, Supply Chain, and Strategic Planning. Each of these services are invoked by or called upon to support the core mission areas. Further analysis into a business service will help to understand the impact of that service with regard to its role in delivering health care, helping to ensure the portfolio of Business Services aim to support the changing needs and objectives of the VHA.
children.description: Manage Business Enabling Services includes business and enterprise services that support the health care mission activities.
children.name: Manage Business Enabling Services

description: The Health Care Segment uses federal programs and activities to provide for the health and well-being of the public. This includes the direct provision of health care services and immunizations as well as the monitoring and tracking of public health indicators for the detection of trends and identification of widespread illnesses/diseases. It also includes health care benefit programs.
name: The Health Care Segment
